TopicTitle: Did you see that before? KSP bug?

Articles.Content:
Just have a look..

<iframe width="560" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/G32PhBrR-aU" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen></iframe>
Wow. Is this legit ? I've never seen it. Maybe belongs in Support more than General Discussion, but... Impressive in any case !
I've seen that before, always when a flyby of the moon would put me on an escape trajectory, but my Pe was below the surface.

That can happen when you change the patched conics settings: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/16172-How-to-change-Patched-Conics-mode?highlight=patched+conics It's just a matter of the curve projection getting confused when you try to have it think too far ahead. Your ship won't actually do that.
i like to think they're interplanetary pathways
Ooooh! You broke space. Space Kraken's gonna git you now.
Don't mind that cheat thingy...
Yeah I've seen that before, happens on my Kerbol escape trajectories, I think it fixes when you exit Kerbin's SOI
